Hey #datascience twitter - I'm seeing a lot of hype around @DataPolars as a #pandas alternative. 

As far as I can tell it solves a bunch of gripes related to pandas' speed. 

Is it worth spending time to switch when I'm rarely up against speed or memory constraints?

@kennedymwavu @rstats_tweets Inside `rowSums()` we use `pick()` to select the variables we want to sum up. 

We use `paste0()` to create a character vector of variable names. First we specify "a_" or "b_" followed by a numeric vector ranging from the value of the current iteration to 2022.
@kennedymwavu @rstats_tweets Here is how I would do it (code in ALT): https://t.co/madx8e4cld

urls.title: Mirai Solutions :: 2023 Workshops Series Kick-off
urls.description: Between May and June, we are proposing again two learning paths: R & Shiny, with few variations compared to last year. Like always, the workshops composing a path can be purchased singularly. Who has already a base of R or Shiny programming may like to join only the more advanced workshops, while those wishing to start from scratch and reach a more advanced level within a short time, can follow the full path investing an afternoon every week. Our focus is on bringing our professional expertise to our

urls.title: dataviz OR datavis since:2023-03-27 until:2023-04-03 Twitter NodeXL SNA Map and Report for Monday, 0
urls.description: The graph represents a network of 3,873 Twitter users whose recent tweets contained "dataviz OR datavis since:2023-03-27 until:2023-04-03", or who were replied to or mentioned in those tweets, taken from a data set limited to a maximum of 18,000 tweets. The network was obtained from Twitter on Monday, 03 April 2023 at 10:42 UTC. The tweets in the network were tweeted over the 6-day, 23-hour, 43-minute period from Monday, 27 March 2023 at 00:02 UTC to Sunday, 02 April 2023 at 23:45 UTC. Additional tweets that were mentioned in this data set were also collected from prior time periods. These tweets may expand the complete time period of the data. There is an edge for each "replies-to" relationship in a tweet, an edge for each "mentions" relationship in a tweet, and a self-loop edge for each tweet that is not a "replies-to" or "mentions". The graph is directed. The graph's vertices were grouped by cluster using the Clauset-Newman-Moore cluster algorithm. The graph was laid out using the H
